newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bundesbank chief Tietmeyer uninjured in car crash.
newsitem.headline: Bundesbank chief Tietmeyer uninjured in car crash.

text.p: Hans Tietmeyer, president of Germany's influential Bundesbank central bank, escaped injury on Thursday when a car he was travelling in was hit on a Bavarian highway, police said.

Tietmeyer was on his way to address a meeting of Finance Minister Theo Waigel's Christian Social Union (CSU) party south of Munich when another car rammed into the back of his vehicle at about 80 km per hour.
Police said the other driver first ploughed into the back of another car in the fast left lane before veering right and hitting Tietmeyer's car in the middle lane.
The driver had apparently lost control while braking when the traffic ahead of her on the crowded highway slowed down, they said.
Tietmeyer's car suffered only minor damage and his driver and bodyguard were also unhurt.
